publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 15:52:34 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Morris Golden was a Communist activist in the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America. Collection contains papers pertaining to Golden's political work, particularly with the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America in the 1940s. Includes minutes, correspondence, and pamphlets.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Provenance unknown; most likely donated by Frances Golden in circa 2008. The accession number associated with this collection is 2008.056.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Morris Golden was a Communist activist in the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers pertaining to Golden's political work, particularly with the American Labor Party and United Federal Workers of America in the 1940s. Includes minutes, correspondence, and pamphlets.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1945-1949, are expected to enter the public domain in 2069.
